snippet: The Schoolhouse Theater’s harrowing production about alcoholism, directed by Pamela Moller Kareman, follows J. P. Miller’s original TV script, not the 1962 film.
abstract: Anita Gates reviews play Days of Wine and Roses, based on 1958 television play by J P Miller, at the Schoolhouse Theater in Croton Falls; play is directed by Pamela Moller Kareman and stars Quinn Cassavale and Rich Orlow (Metropolitan/Westchester).
lead_paragraph: The Schoolhouse Theater’s harrowing production about alcoholism, directed by Pamela Moller Kareman, follows J. P. Miller’s original TV script, not the 1962 film.
